data.event: As of the 2010 United States Census, the city's population was 9,920, reflecting an increase of 184 (+1.9%) from the 9,736 counted in the 2000 Census, which had in turn declined by 99 (-1.0%) from the 9,835 counted in the 1990 Census.

As of the 2010 United States Census, the city's population was 9,920, reflecting an increase of 184 (+1.9%) from the 9,736 counted in the 2000 Census, which had in turn declined by 99 (-1.0%) from the 9,835 counted in the 1990 Census.
Burlington was first incorporated on October 24, 1693, and was reincorporated by Royal charter on May 7, 1733.

event.title: was reincorporated by Royal charter on May 7, 1733

data.event: Burlington was first incorporated on October 24, 1693, and was reincorporated by Royal charter on May 7, 1733.

event.title: was incorporated by the State of New Jersey on December 21, 1784

data.event: After American independence, the city was incorporated by the State of New Jersey on December 21, 1784.

event.title: March 14, 1851, the city was reincorporated and enlarged

data.event: On March 14, 1851, the city was reincorporated and enlarged with portions of the surrounding township.

event.title: 1796, as the population had been increasing

data.event: Burlington was originally the county seat of Burlington County but in 1796, as the population had been increasing to the east away from the Delaware River, the county seat was moved to Mount Holly Township, a more central location.

event.title: purchased roughly 30 miles (48 km) of riverfront land in 1676

data.event: The council of West Jersey Proprietors purchased roughly 30 miles (48 km) of riverfront land in 1676 from the Lenape Native Americans.

event.title: was founded on part of that land by English settlers (primarily Quakers) in 1677

data.event: Burlington was founded on part of that land by English settlers (primarily Quakers) in 1677, and served as the capital of the province until 1702, when West Jersey and East Jersey were combined into a singe Crown Colony.

event.title: served as the capital of the province until 1702

data.event: Burlington was founded on part of that land by English settlers (primarily Quakers) in 1677, and served as the capital of the province until 1702, when West Jersey and East Jersey were combined into a singe Crown Colony.
